thread.title: 'The future is female': Young feminists you should be following on Twitter

author: USATODAY College
title: 'The future is female': Young feminists you should be following on Twitter
text:
3. Their Eyes Were Watching God 4. Catch-22 
‚Äî Yara shahidi (@YaraShahidi) February 3, 2017 Divided by gender because God forbid a woman be interested in money management & a man wants to learn how to bake pic.twitter.com/Mc9s6MEnmN 
‚Äî Yara shahidi (@YaraShahidi) April 26, 2016 Alexandra Svokos 
As a senior politics writer at Elite Daily , Svokos meshes together fair reporting with lots of Twitter opinions ‚Äî on feminism, President Trump and life in general. I asked Giuliani if Trump is a feminist #DebateNight pic.twitter.com/xWvkgVuKXV 
‚Äî Alexandra Svokos (@asvokos) September 27, 2016 Trump wants to undo Roe and take away abortion rights. This is what that world looks like https://t.co/3c9ecwLsEd pic.twitter.com/jBbwvYlzMf 
‚Äî Alexandra Svokos (@asvokos) January 24, 2017 Akilah Hughes 
The Brooklyn-based Akilah Hughes is a comedian, YouTuber and writer who uses her platform to discuss everything from women‚Äôs rights to politics and everything in between. So since we're doing some big-idea thinking today, let's tackle intersectionality in feminism AND pizzas. http://t.co/yJasF70jnT 
‚Äî Akilah Hughes (@AkilahObviously) April 8, 2015 "I like Mulan. She's my favorite superhero."‚Äì my nephew, the feminist hope for the future. pic.twitter.com/OdfJ7VWwNo 
‚Äî Akilah Hughes (@AkilahObviously) December 27, 2015 Kaylene Wright 
The Hood College senior, who‚Äôs majoring in political science & communication (and is a Congressional intern), uses her Twitter account to do just that ‚Äî communicate about politics. Hello! Letting the world know that I #DressLikeAWoman ! pic.twitter.com/2NiglxOovb 
‚Äî Kaylene Wright (@kayleneannawyn) February 4, 2017 Sometimes I forget that outside of my tolerant friend and political group that there are still people who insist that feminism hates all men 
‚Äî Kaylene Wright (@kayleneannawyn) December 20, 2014 Matt McGorry 
@MattMcGorry 
In between his roles as Asher on How to Get Away With Murder and Bennett on Orange Is the New Black , actor Matt McGorry is a vocal and outspoken advocate. His Twitter bio even identifies him as an ‚Äúintersectional feminist.‚Äù "The Guy's Guide To Feminism" by @GenderEQ & @MichaelS_Kimmel for men who refuse to listen to women about feminism üôÑ pic.twitter.com/FYseNrjgsf 
‚Äî Matt McGorry (@MattMcGorry) June 27, 2016 I'm embarrassed to admit that I only recently discovered the ACTUAL definition of "feminism". The fact that the‚Ä¶ http://t.co/qUpxwYtb8I 
‚Äî Matt McGorry (@MattMcGorry) March 5, 2015 Sophia Bush 
@SophiaBush 
You may know her as Brooke Davis on One Tree Hill or Erin Lindsay on Chicago PD , but the real-life Sophia Bush has an incredibly active Twitter presence where she talks about women‚Äôs empowerment, feminism and girls‚Äô education: Real talk. Just realized that Stick It is a total feminist masterpiece. And my favorite kind of early 2000s kitsch #StickIt #NoLoveInterests 
‚Äî Sophia Bush (@SophiaBush) August 14, 2016 Yes. I am a woman. Yes. I am a feminist. Wanting to be treated equally isn't waging a war. It's common sense. See @wearetheXX ‚ù§Ô∏è #women 
‚Äî Sophia Bush (@SophiaBush) August 7, 2014 Mari Copeny, AKA Little Miss Flint
